cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.ITP. 

The paper deals with entropy and random variables, which are topics commonly studied in information theory (cs.IT). The analysis of equality cases involves geometry and symmetry, which are also relevant in the study of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also presents an inequality for linear transformations, which is a topic in machine learning and statistics (cs.LG). The study of entropy and joint distributions is also relevant in the field of signal processing and information retrieval (cs.SI). Finally, the paper's focus on lower bounds and equality cases suggests that it may also be relevant to the study of information theory and probability (cs.ITP).
